ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Rural Reconstruction Society(RRS) is a voluntary organization setup in 1983 to strengthen the creativity of grassroots innovators engaged in conserving biodiversity and developing eco -friendly solutions to local problems, based in Angallu a tinny village near Madanapalle of Chittoor District, Andhra Pradesh. RRS is devoted to empowering knowledge rich, economically poor people by adding value in their contemporary creativity as well as traditional knowledge. It supports the activities of the Self-help Groups (SHGs), Community Based Organizations (CBOs), and networks to respect, recognize and reward creativity at grass roots. The organization is working in about 275 villages with womens sanghams in 6 mandals of Chittoor Dist. The RRS is developing a working model for the people oriented participative development in the areas of food security, ecological agriculture, alternative education, creative and prevention of health education, women empowerment and human rights etc. One of its core programmes deals with prevention of surreptious spread of HIV/AIDS.

Recognized as Business Incubation Centre (MSME) by Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Govt. of India. All UG Programs are permanently affiliated by Andhra University. Accredited Thrice by National Board of Accreditation (NBA). Secured the status of 2(f) and 12(B) of UGC Act in 1988. Departments of Civil, ECE, EEE, IT and Mech. were recognized as Research Centers by Andhra University. Ranked as 25th in top 100 Private Engineering Colleges in India by Higher Education Review. Ranked as 32nd in Top 100 Engineering Colleges in India and 10th in Top 12 Engineering Colleges in South India by Silicon India Ranked as 59 in Top 100 Private T-Schools 2016 in India by Data Quest. Awarded as Best Engineering College in South India by National Education Excellence. Higher Education Review recognized our college as Engineering College of the Year 2015. Silicon India recognized our college as College of the Year 2015. AP State Government Knowledge Mission graded us A-Grade College. Our college is recognized as e.gov campus by Engineering Watch. IBM Ranked Our College as One of the Top 30 Colleges in India for Excellence in Great Mind Challenge. Consortium Member in Indo-US Collaboration for Engineering Education (IUCEE) 40 MoUs with Foreign Universities, Institutions and Industries. MoUs with Lucerne University of Applied Sciences and Arts, School of Information Technology, Switzerland; Department of Computer Science of University of Verona, Italy and Omsk State Tranport University, Russia. MoU with Harvard Business School, USA to conduct Soft Skills Training Programme. One among the four colleges in Andhra Pradesh. Collaborative Research Works with Netherland Universities, American and Australian Universities. 8 Center of Excellences are established. Excellent infrastructure. Adequate Research Labs are available. Wi-Fi Enabled Campus, Microsoft Cloud Enabled Campus. MOOCS Online Courses, Digital Libraries, Technology Initiative Labs are available in the Campus. Got All India 1st, 2nd, 4th,6th , 8th,12th, 14th, 18th, 21st, 22nd, 27th, 47th and 83rd GATE Ranks Bagged Most of the Top 10 University Ranks, Best awards from Research Organizations and Multinational Companies. Best Placements in the state of A.P. from last 20 years. All Most All the MNCs Visit our Campus, Max salary Package 7.25Lacks. Students Activities were recorded in LIMCA Book of Records, Wonder Book of Records and Unique World Records four times. Innovation Centers, Incubation Centers, Entrepreneur Development Center, Career Development Center, GATE Coaching, GRE and CAT Training Centers are in Campus. We offer the Consultancy to ONGC, Reliance, IDEA, A.P, Transco, Indian Railways, Panchayath Raj, Irrigation, A.P. State Government and Central Government Departments. Most of our students are working in Fortune 100 companies. Alumni have occupied very high positions at National and International Level. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Mobilised 100 to 150 days employment in each of the year for the rural poor workers. Approximately 18600 workers are able to get the employment under NREGA ( National Rural Employment Guarantee Act) and stopped 85% of distress migration. Stopped 1620 child labour from both agriculture and non agriculture areas and enrolled them into the schools and monitor their regularity. Landless Dalit youth are educated and engaged in campaign for land. In the last one decade, 12620 acres of land is identified and distributed 5200 landless Dalit women who are intern in the process of converting the waste land into cultivable and also take up biodiversity based agriculture. So far, 1613 acres of land is brought under sustainable agriculture establishing seed banks in 18 villages. BDA involving methodology of: land levelling  Vermi-compost production - soil enrichment through tank silt application  pest management. Centralized service support through 18 seed banks with stock of drought resisted traditional seeds 860 rural Dalit families are consistently engaged in sustainable agriculture in dry lands and are able to produce minor millets & lentils and got out of the hunger and poverty. 3650 Dalit and Adivasi women are identified as most vulnerable single women in the project area living in inhuman conditions. Majority of them are shelterless and live at the mercy of brothers or brother-in-law houses working as bonded and unpaid workers. United them as association and campaign for their basic amenities viz. Housing, PDS cards, pension cards, health cards and development schemes from the government. SO far 1248 single women got access to Govt. housing program , 65% got PDS cards recognisieng them as separate family unit. 2935 out of 3650 single women are able to get NREGA cards and engaging in 100 days employment. 715 single women got house plots from government , 310 women got housing program, 1860 single women recognised as a family unit and got PDS cards, health cards, and also pensions. Mobilised income generation schemes from government and also from citizens. So far 1200 women got support as small shop keepers, vegetable vendors, own milk animals and goats. Campaign against female feticides among Dalits and backward castes led to closure of 6 illegal scanning centres and women associations in 40 villages are monitoring violence against women on dowry, minor girl child marriages, child labour and proper functioning of mid day meal in the schools. Identify and support destitute children and enrolled them into government free boarding schools. 30 children are supported.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Brief Narrative about the Organisation Sahayog Community Coordination Network (CCN) is a registered Not- for-Profit Society consisting of a group of experienced professionals and educated tribal youths intensely working with the vulnerable indigenous groups to support them to gain control over their lives and resources in two Mandals of Paderu Region, Visakhapatnam district of Andhra Pradesh. The Organisation was promoted by the eminent Civil Servant (Late Mr. S.R. Sankaran IAS) who has been the guide and support for this Organisation since its origin along with other likeminded civil servants interested in Tribal empowerment. The objective of the Organisation was to attract young professionals from reputed academic Institutes to engage themselves in tribal development and bridge the gap between Government policies and their execution in the community. The Young professionals were given intensive mentorship under the Head of Premier Organisation on Tribal development- Girijan Cooperative Co operation and ITDA to work with community at cluster level. The Organisation was evolved after 3 years of work by the professionals to support and sustain the work carried out. Sahayog CCN is working in Munchingput and Peddabayalu Mandals of Paderu division, Andhra Pradesh. The major livelihood issues in this region has been depleted natural resources of land and water, poor health and nutritional status, poor educational and infrastructure facilities and very low level of household income which is around Rs.10, 000 to Rs.15, 000 /per annum which is much lower in terms of the standards elsewhere in the country. Organisations Vision : Self reliant tribal community who has full ownership and control over their resources and capable to take decisions on their lives. Mission : The Mission is to build self sustained organization of vulnerable tribal communities to improve their standard of living through sustainable use of natural resources with their full ownership, participation and Trust. Our Core Values.  Trust.  Transparency.  Farmers Interest First.  Participation by all. Sahayog CCN works towards a self reliant Tribal community and its role has been defined as: 1. Facilitator of empowerment processes in the community. 2. Capacity building and skill development of the Community. 3. Network and collaboration with external and internal stakeholders and mobilisation of resources for the Community. Sahayog CCN adopts a 3 pronged strategy for its community empowerment process. 1. Source Young Professionals from relevant academic backgrounds from premier institutes in India and train them on key aspects of community development and empowerment. 2. Young Professionals deployed at cluster level in turn identify educated local tribal youth and provide the training on development issues and build a Team named Community Coordination Team (CCTs) to carry on with the activities and become entrepreneurs for the community. 3. Build paraprofessional at cluster level and establish linkages with partners and collaborators and source resources. The critical strategy is to promote and strengthen Tribal community institutions Federated at multiple layers with full participation by Tribal women in the area. Leveraging on existing community resources is specifically employed to ensure sustainability of the institutions and community initiatives even after the project exit. CCN has worked with number of Partners- Government Agencies, National and International funding partners. Research institutions etc. and have over 2 decades of experience in working with the tribal communities.

Help them to use personal protective equipment wearing masks. Handwash besides taking proper care when

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Local Contribution One free Medical Camp Was conducted by SMF during the reporting year at Purlameraka Village in Nizampatnam revenue Mandal. Over 250 indivuduals (mostly Women & Children) were diagnosed and were provided with Medicines during the camp.

LOCAL DONATIONS Uniform distribution in local schools: During the reporting year, the SMF organized Annual General body meeting of all the members in a village called Purlameraka.Several youth attended and extended all the possible support. Members went and approached the local Rotary Club members and also the Ready Made Cloth association merchants. They were kind enough to provide dresses to male as well as female children of local schools.School teachers and also the children were quite happy.

LOCAL DONATIONS Youth and Women Capacity Building Trainings: Awareness generation training programs were organized in target villages on various issues they are facing in their habitations. Youth were provided with information on various skills that they can undergo to lead dignified life situations. Some youth were provided with career guidance - after completing Xth standard, various courses they can choose to go for higher education within their localities and the neighboring towns.

ngoList.title: SIRISHA REHABILITATION CENTRE
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sirisha Rehabilitation Centre (SRC) is working for the targetted group of people starting from the stage of identification to empowerment on life cycle basis. It is based in the rural parts of Krishna District and thus addressing th needs of the people based on their challenges, skills, needs and living circumstances. In this process, SRC crossed several milestones and created significnat impact among the stakeholders and thus supported by way of support, projects & networking. It could mainstream several children who are out of the school due to various reasons. In addition it also extends the support for the Old Aged People, people living /affected with HIV / AIDS and other needy people. Recently, it has got the project support form The National Trust for the ASPIRATION - an early intervention programme and Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan for the Residential Bridge Camp & Van from State Bank of India. With the experience gained during the last 6 years, SRC is moving forward with suitable future vision suiting to the needs of the targetted people living in the rural areas where poverty is real barrier which forces the people to struggle for the basic living. Thus to reach its targets,SRC needs the suppoert from the Government and other stakeholders.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Promoted by a group of development professionals, SkillPro Foundation focuses on the issues in sectors like Education and Livelihoods in rural and urban areas. SkillPro is engaged in: Skill training for varied categories of people in vocational skills Conceptualizing, operationalizing and implementing large scale development programmes, both in urban and rural areas Development and dissemination of quality training material, reference material, training manuals, modules and toolkits Large scale research, impact assessment studies, planning, monitoring and evaluation assignments Creative communication, documentation and designing with Emphasis on use of participatory approaches in all its activities Capacity building and training With its headquarters at Hyderabad SkillPro has been working in the states of Andhra Pradesh, Tamilnadu, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat,Maharashtra, Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Chattisgarh and union territory of Dadra Nagar and Haveli. Livelihoods (Skill Training) Skill training centres of SkillPro has a competitive team with excellence in implementing large scale skill development programs. This skill training focuses on people with minimum educational qualification (class VII and above) with no skills and employability. They are trained for 3-4 months, in the trade, based on their aptitude and would be prepared for entry level jobs. Here, the focus is on subject specific content delivery, practical sessions, on the job training and development of soft skills. It would also include linking them to employers for apprenticeship or on the job training. Salient features of skill training programs of SkillPro include: Initiated 8 centres across Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Dadar & Nagar Haveli Focus on new and emerging sectors like IT enabled services, customer relations management, sales and marketing, bed side nursing, automobile repairs etc Focus on soft skills with in addition to technical skills Short term, 3-4 month courses Training, Research and Capacity Building Developing various monitoring and evaluation frameworks, conducting studies like market scan, impact assessment of various developmental projects, developing various training modules and training and capacity building activities across the development spectrum are few of the key activities underaken by SkillPro. These ranges from issues pertaining to livelihoods, watershed, behavioral change, education, Panchayati Raj Institutions, local self governance, gender etc. Few of the research and capacity building assignments conducted by SkillPro include: End Term Evaluation of Green Post Tsunami Action Project for Humana People to People India Training Modules on Disaster Preparedness and Mitigation for Aide et Action Impact Assessment of Watershed in Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh for NIRD, Hyderabad Evaluation of Watershed in Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh for NIRD, Hyderabad Evaluation of National Rural Employment Guarantee Program (NREGA)in Chittoo, Andhra Pradesh Monitoring tools to track behavioral changes at the village level for UNICEF Training of Trainers Related to Component-I of the Andhra Pradesh Community Based Tank Management Project Preparation of 26000 hours of e-Lessons for Polytechnics for Department of Technical Education, Andhra Pradesh

sourceOfFunds.purpose: (i) Collecting the produce from farmers and lifting to common facility center in the evening as per the market rate the produce will be sold to traders with minimum percentage. (ii) Providing inputs like seed, fertilizers and pesticides through FPO. (iii) Providing agriculture implements to the farmers through FPO. (iv) Providing extension services, government subsidy schemes, Credit linkage, Capacity building and FPO management with support of local POPI auditors, Banks andgovernment department

SEVA has done Financial Literacy Awareness Program with the support of NABARD. Under this programme, awareness through the Kalajatha, Distribution of pamphlets, conducting rallies, Organising Mass meetings, Survey, Quiz competitions etc. The programme aim is to make the People and mainly Households in the villages to open a Jandhan Bank Account for all the members in the house and use bank services like Savings, Deposits, Loans, Insurance, Electronic transactions etc.

In West Godavari District the program  Solid waste management project is implementing in 9 Municipalities i.e. 1).Eluru, 2).Tadepalligudem, 3).Tanuku, 4).Nidadavole, 5). Kovvuru, 6).Palakole, 7).Narasapuram, 8).Bhimavaram and 9).Janagareddygudem with the support of DMA, SCIMMU team, in coordination with Local Municipality Commissioners. As per the DMA office and SCIMMU technical guidelines the SEVA- Social Education and Voluntary Action is implementing activities

(i) Planned village level collection center. (ii) Providing agriculture implements to the farmers through FPO. (iii) Providing extension services, government subsidy schemes,Planning to get Credit linkage, Capacity building and FPO management with support of local POPI auditors, Banks and government departments.
